description: Provides income support of ₹6,000 per year to all farmer families, paid in three equal installments of ₹2,000.
beneficiaries: All small and marginal farmers with land ownership.
keyFeatures: Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT) to farmers' bank accounts
Financial assistance to improve agricultural productivity
eligibility: Farmers with cultivable land in their name.

description: Provides crop insurance to farmers to protect them against losses due to natural calamities, pests, and diseases.
beneficiaries: All farmers growing notified crops in notified areas.
eligibility: Farmers growing notified crops and registered under the scheme.

description: Offers credit to farmers for crop production and allied agricultural activities at concessional interest rates.
beneficiaries: Farmers engaged in agriculture, animal husbandry, fisheries, and other allied activities.
keyFeatures: Coverage for crop loans, working capital, and personal consumption needs
eligibility: All farmers, including tenant farmers and sharecroppers.

description: Provides farmers with soil health cards containing crop-specific recommendations for nutrient and fertilizer use.
Creates a unified online market platform to connect agricultural markets across the country.
eligibility: Farmers with agricultural produce to sell.

description: Promotes organic farming practices to reduce dependency on chemical fertilizers and pesticides.
beneficiaries: Farmers interested in adopting organic farming.
keyFeatures: Training and capacity building for organic farming
eligibility: Groups of farmers or clusters practicing organic farming.

description: Supports state governments in developing agriculture and allied sectors.
Aims to improve water use efficiency in agriculture and ensure access to water for irrigation.
keyFeatures: Promotes micro-irrigation methods like drip and sprinkler systems
Ensures 'Har Khet Ko Pani' (water for every field)
eligibility: Farmers practicing agriculture in water-scarce regions.
